title: Electrostatics - effect of charge on force

content.description: Three charged particles, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, are placed along a horizontal line. Positively charged particles <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, each with charge of magnitude <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>, are placed on each end of the line, while the negatively charged Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, with charge of magnitude <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>, is placed in the middle. Each charged particle is separated by a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>d</mi></math>, and the positive direction is to the right, as shown in the figure.
content.question: In the original configuration of the three charged particles, Particle <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> experiences a force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> from Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> only. If the magnitude of the charge of Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is changed to <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>, what is the new force on Particle <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> from Particle <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> only?
